snippet: Commenting on his 2014 suspension for the first time, Alex Rodriguez told reporters in Mexico City that “2014 will be a good year to rest physically, mentally and to prepare for the future.”
abstract: Alex Rodriguez appears a step closer to accepting the likelihood that he will not be playing major league baseball in 2014, but he is also confident he will be back; New York Yankees third baseman says that the full-season doping suspension he is scheduled to serve could turn out to be a 'big favor' because he has been playing for '20 years without a timeout.'
lead_paragraph: Commenting on his 2014 suspension for the first time, Alex Rodriguez told reporters in Mexico City that “2014 will be a good year to rest physically, mentally and to prepare for the future.”

headline.main: Alex Rodriguez Seems to Accept That Suspension Will Stand
headline.print_headline: Rodriguez Says 2014 May Be a Good Year ‘to Rest’
